Mark__07.1: And there assembled together unto him the Pharisees and some of the scribes, coming from Jerusalem.
Mark__07.2: And when they had seen some of his disciples eat bread with common, that is, with unwashed hands, they found fault.
Mark__07.3: For the Pharisees, and all the Jews eat not without often washing their hands, holding the tradition of the ancients:
Mark__07.4: And when they come from the market, unless they be washed, they eat not: and many other things there are that have been delivered to them to observe, the washings of cups and of pots, and of brazen vessels, and of beds.
Mark__07.5: And the Pharisees and scribes asked him: Why do not thy disciples walk according to the tradition of the ancients, but they eat bread with common hands?
Mark__07.6: But he answering, said to them: Well did Isaias prophesy of you hypocrites, as it is written: This people honoureth me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.
Mark__07.7: And in vain do they worship me, teaching <u>doctrines and precepts of men</u>.
Mark__07.8: For leaving the commandment of God, you hold the tradition of men, the washing of pots and of cups: and many other things you do like to these.
Mark__07.9: And he said to them: Well do you make void the commandment of God, that you may keep your own tradition.
Mark__07.10: For Moses said: Honour thy father and thy mother; and He that shall curse father or mother, dying let him die.
Mark__07.11: But you say: If a man shall say to his father or mother, Corban, (which is a gift,) whatsoever is from me, shall profit thee.
Mark__07.12: And further you suffer him not to do any thing for his father or mother,
Mark__07.13: Making void the word of God by your own tradition, which you have given forth. And many other such like things you do.
Mark__07.14: And calling again the multitude unto him, he said to them: Hear ye me all, and understand.
Mark__07.15: There is nothing from without a man that entering into him, can defile him. But the things which come from a man, those are they that defile a man.
Mark__07.16: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.
Mark__07.17: And when he was come into the house from the multitude, his disciples asked him the parable.
Mark__07.18: And he saith to them: So are you also without knowledge? understand you not that every thing from without, entering into a man cannot defile him:
Mark__07.19: Because it entereth not into his heart, but goeth into the belly, and goeth out into the privy, purging all meats?
Mark__07.20: But he said that the things which come out from a man, they defile a man.
Mark__07.21: For from within out of the heart of men proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders,
Mark__07.22: Thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness.
Mark__07.23: All these evil things come from within, and defile a man.
Mark__07.24: And rising from thence he went into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon: and entering into a house, he would that no man should know it, and he could not be hid.
Mark__07.25: For a woman as soon as she heard of him, whose daughter had an unclean spirit, came in and fell down at his feet.
Mark__07.26: For the woman was a Gentile, a Syrophenician born. And she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter.
Mark__07.27: Who said to her: Suffer first the children to be filled: for it is not good to take the bread of the children, and cast it to the dogs.
Mark__07.28: But she answered and said to him: Yea, Lord; for the whelps also eat under the table of the crumbs of the children.
Mark__07.29: And he said to her: For this saying go thy way, the devil is gone out of thy daughter.
Mark__07.30: And when she was come into her house, she found the girl lying upon the bed, and that the devil was gone out.
Mark__07.31: And again going out of the coasts of Tyre, he came by Sidon to the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis.
Mark__07.32: And they bring to him one deaf and dumb; and they besought him that he would lay his hand upon him.
Mark__07.33: And taking him from the multitude apart, he put his fingers into his ears, and spitting, he touched his tongue:
Mark__07.34: And looking up to heaven, he groaned, and said to him: Ephpheta, which is, Be thou opened.
Mark__07.35: And immediately his ears were opened, and the string of his tongue was loosed, and he spoke right.
Mark__07.36: And he charged them that they should tell no man. But the more he charged them, so much the more a great deal did they publish it.
Mark__07.37: And so much the more did they wonder, saying: He hath done all things well; he hath made both the deaf to hear, and the dumb to speak.
